channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: TencentLLMEval: A Hierarchical Evaluation of Real-World Capabilities for Human-Aligned LLMs
item.description: We construct a hierarchical task tree encompassing 7 major areas covering over 200 categories and over 800 tasks, which covers diverse capabilities such as question answering, reasoning, multiturn dialogue, and text generation, to evaluate LLMs in a comprehensive and in-depth manner.

item.title: Uncertainty-Aware Bayes' Rule and Its Applications
item.description: Philosophically, the key is to balance the relative importance of prior and data distributions when calculating posterior distributions: if prior (resp.

item.title: A Survey of Large Language Models in Medicine: Progress, Application, and Challenge
item.description: Therefore, the application of LLMs in medicine to assist physicians and patient care emerges as a promising research direction in both artificial intelligence and clinical medicine.

item.title: 3DStyle-Diffusion: Pursuing Fine-grained Text-driven 3D Stylization with 2D Diffusion Models
item.description: In this work, we propose a new 3DStyle-Diffusion model that triggers fine-grained stylization of 3D meshes with additional controllable appearance and geometric guidance from 2D Diffusion models.

item.title: SynFacePAD 2023: Competition on Face Presentation Attack Detection Based on Privacy-aware Synthetic Training Data
item.description: This paper presents a summary of the Competition on Face Presentation Attack Detection Based on Privacy-aware Synthetic Training Data (SynFacePAD 2023) held at the 2023 International Joint Conference on Biometrics (IJCB 2023).

item.title: High-Performance Transformers for Table Structure Recognition Need Early Convolutions
item.description: This allows it to "see" an appropriate portion of the table and "store" the complex table structure within sufficient context length for the subsequent transformer.

item.title: A Coefficient Makes SVRG Effective
item.description: Stochastic Variance Reduced Gradient (SVRG), introduced by Johnson & Zhang (2013), is a theoretically compelling optimization method.

item.title: Efficient Parallelization Layouts for Large-Scale Distributed Model Training
item.description: In this work, we conduct a comprehensive ablation study of possible training configurations for large language models.

item.title: meta4: semantically-aligned generation of metaphoric gestures using self-supervised text and speech representation
item.description: Our approach is the first method for generating speech driven metaphoric gestures while leveraging the potential of Image Schemas.

item.title: Latent Task-Specific Graph Network Simulators
item.description: Movement primitives further allow us to accommodate various types of context data, as demonstrated through the utilization of point clouds during inference.

item.title: Do Ensembling and Meta-Learning Improve Outlier Detection in Randomized Controlled Trials?
item.description: We began by empirically evaluating 6 modern machine learning-based outlier detection algorithms on the task of identifying irregular data in 838 datasets from 7 real-world MCRCTs with a total of 77, 001 patients from over 44 countries.

item.title: Mirror: A Universal Framework for Various Information Extraction Tasks
item.description: Sharing knowledge between information extraction tasks has always been a challenge due to the diverse data formats and task variations.

item.title: Accuracy of a Vision-Language Model on Challenging Medical Cases
item.description: Conclusions: GPT-4V outperformed human respondents on challenging medical cases and was able to synthesize information from both images and text, but performance deteriorated when images were added to highly informative text.

item.title: PRODIGy: a PROfile-based DIalogue Generation dataset
item.description: Providing dialogue agents with a profile representation can improve their consistency and coherence, leading to better conversations.

item.title: Counterfactually Fair Representation
item.description: It was shown in \cite{kusner2017counterfactual} that a sufficient condition for satisfying CF is to \textbf{not} use features that are descendants of sensitive attributes in the causal graph.

item.title: EEG-DG: A Multi-Source Domain Generalization Framework for Motor Imagery EEG Classification
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel multi-source domain generalization framework called EEG-DG, which leverages multiple source domains with different statistical distributions to build generalizable models on unseen target EEG data.

item.title: LCM-LoRA: A Universal Stable-Diffusion Acceleration Module
item.description: Latent Consistency Models (LCMs) have achieved impressive performance in accelerating text-to-image generative tasks, producing high-quality images with minimal inference steps.

item.title: FigStep: Jailbreaking Large Vision-language Models via Typographic Visual Prompts
item.description: Above all, our experimental results reveal that VLMs are vulnerable to jailbreaking attacks, which highlights the necessity of novel safety alignments between visual and textual modalities.

item.title: RAPID: Training-free Retrieval-based Log Anomaly Detection with PLM considering Token-level information
item.description: We introduce RAPID, a model that capitalizes on the inherent features of log data to enable anomaly detection without training delays, ensuring real-time capability.

item.title: Linear Gaussian Bounding Box Representation and Ring-Shaped Rotated Convolution for Oriented Object Detection
item.description: On the other hand, current rotation-sensitive feature extraction methods based on convolutions can only extract features under a local receptive field, which is slow in aggregating rotation-sensitive features.

item.title: Weakly-supervised Deep Cognate Detection Framework for Low-Resourced Languages Using Morphological Knowledge of Closely-Related Languages
item.description: We train an encoder to gain morphological knowledge of a language and transfer the knowledge to perform unsupervised and weakly-supervised cognate detection tasks with and without the pivot language for the closely-related languages.

item.title: Cross-modal Prompts: Adapting Large Pre-trained Models for Audio-Visual Downstream Tasks
item.description: This mechanism leverages audio and visual modalities as soft prompts to dynamically adjust the parameters of pre-trained models based on the current multi-modal input features.

item.title: Conic10K: A Challenging Math Problem Understanding and Reasoning Dataset
item.description: Since the dataset only involves a narrow range of knowledge, it is easy to separately analyse the knowledge a model possesses and the reasoning ability it has.

item.title: Outlier-Robust Wasserstein DRO
item.description: Geometric uncertainty due to sampling or localized perturbations of data points is captured by Wasserstein DRO (WDRO), which seeks to learn a model that performs uniformly well over a Wasserstein ball centered around the observed data distribution.

item.title: Data Valuation and Detections in Federated Learning
item.description: Federated Learning (FL) enables collaborative model training without sharing raw data, demanding abundant, high-quality data for optimal model performance.

item.title: A Deep Learning Method for Simultaneous Denoising and Missing Wedge Reconstruction in Cryogenic Electron Tomography
item.description: Tomograms reconstructed with conventional methods, such as filtered back-projection, suffer from the noise, and from artifacts and anisotropic resolution due to the missing wedge of information.

item.title: POISE: Pose Guided Human Silhouette Extraction under Occlusions
item.description: Human silhouette extraction is a fundamental task in computer vision with applications in various downstream tasks.

item.title: Counter-Empirical Attacking based on Adversarial Reinforcement Learning for Time-Relevant Scoring System
item.description: To establish such scoring systems, several "empirical criteria" are firstly determined, followed by dedicated top-down design for each factor of the score, which usually requires enormous effort to adjust and tune the scoring function in the new application scenario.

item.title: On the Road with GPT-4V(ision): Early Explorations of Visual-Language Model on Autonomous Driving
item.description: This has been a significant bottleneck, particularly in the development of common sense reasoning and nuanced scene understanding necessary for safe and reliable autonomous driving.

item.title: Inference for Probabilistic Dependency Graphs
item.description: Probabilistic dependency graphs (PDGs) are a flexible class of probabilistic graphical models, subsuming Bayesian Networks and Factor Graphs.

item.title: Personalized Online Federated Learning with Multiple Kernels
item.description: Federated learning enables a group of learners (called clients) to train an MKL model on the data distributed among clients to perform online non-linear function approximation.

item.title: Byzantine-Tolerant Methods for Distributed Variational Inequalities
item.description: Robustness to Byzantine attacks is a necessity for various distributed training scenarios.

item.title: A Hierarchical Spatial Transformer for Massive Point Samples in Continuous Space
item.description: However, designing a transformer for massive spatial points is non-trivial due to several challenges, including implicit long-range and multi-scale dependency on irregular points in continuous space, a non-uniform point distribution, the potential high computational costs of calculating all-pair attention across massive points, and the risks of over-confident predictions due to varying point density.

item.title: LooGLE: Can Long-Context Language Models Understand Long Contexts?
item.description: In this paper, we present LooGLE, a Long Context Generic Language Evaluation benchmark for LLMs' long context understanding.

item.title: DAMEX: Dataset-aware Mixture-of-Experts for visual understanding of mixture-of-datasets
item.description: Construction of a universal detector poses a crucial question: How can we most effectively train a model on a large mixture of datasets?

item.title: DeepLearningBrasil@LT-EDI-2023: Exploring Deep Learning Techniques for Detecting Depression in Social Media Text
item.description: In this paper, we delineate the strategy employed by our team, DeepLearningBrasil, which secured us the first place in the shared task DepSign-LT-EDI@RANLP-2023, achieving a 47. 0% Macro F1-Score and a notable 2. 4% advantage.

item.title: CAIS-DMA: A Decision-Making Assistant for Collaborative AI Systems
item.description: This paper introduces a new methodology to automatically support the decision-making process in CAIS when the system experiences performance degradation after a disruptive event.

item.title: Active Transfer Learning for Efficient Video-Specific Human Pose Estimation
item.description: Human Pose (HP) estimation is actively researched because of its wide range of applications.

item.title: Recursion in Recursion: Two-Level Nested Recursion for Length Generalization with Scalability
item.description: For the inner recursion, we choose Beam Tree RvNNs (BT-RvNN).

item.title: How Abstract Is Linguistic Generalization in Large Language Models? Experiments with Argument Structure
item.description: We find that LLMs perform well in generalizing the distribution of a novel noun argument between related contexts that were seen during pre-training (e. g., the active object and passive subject of the verb spray), succeeding by making use of the semantically-organized structure of the embedding space for word embeddings.

item.title: Forecasting and predicting stochastic agent-based models of cell migration with biologically-informed neural networks
item.description: In this work, we describe how biologically-informed neural networks (BINNs) can be used to learn BINN-guided PDE models that are capable of accurately predicting ABM behavior.

item.title: Discerning and Enhancing the Weighted Sum-Rate Maximization Algorithms in Communications
item.description: By probing the theoretical underpinnings linking the BCA and MM algorithmic frameworks, we reveal the direct correlations between the equivalent transformation techniques, essential to the development of WMMSE and WSR-FP, and the surrogate functions pivotal to WSR-MM.

item.title: Consensus-based construction of high-dimensional free energy surface
item.description: One essential problem in quantifying the collective behaviors of molecular systems lies in the accurate construction of free energy surfaces (FESs).

item.title: Cross-Silo Federated Learning Across Divergent Domains with Iterative Parameter Alignment
item.description: Learning from the collective knowledge of data dispersed across private sources can provide neural networks with enhanced generalization capabilities.

item.title: Hierarchically Gated Recurrent Neural Network for Sequence Modeling
item.description: Transformers have surpassed RNNs in popularity due to their superior abilities in parallel training and long-term dependency modeling.

item.title: Transfer learning from a sparsely annotated dataset of 3D medical images
item.description: A base segmentation model (3D U-Net) was trained on a large and sparsely annotated dataset; its weights were used for transfer learning on four new down-stream segmentation tasks for which a fully annotated dataset was available.

item.title: RDGCN: Reinforced Dependency Graph Convolutional Network for Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Aspect-based sentiment analysis (ABSA) is dedicated to forecasting the sentiment polarity of aspect terms within sentences.

item.title: The PetShop Dataset -- Finding Causes of Performance Issues across Microservices
item.description: Although the machine learning and systems research communities have proposed various techniques to tackle this problem, there is currently a lack of standardized datasets for quantitative benchmarking.

item.title: Lidar Annotation Is All You Need
item.description: One of the fundamental tasks in computer vision is semantic image segmentation, which is vital for precise object delineation.

item.title: On Characterizing the Evolution of Embedding Space of Neural Networks using Algebraic Topology
item.description: We study how the topology of feature embedding space changes as it passes through the layers of a well-trained deep neural network (DNN) through Betti numbers.
